  96 def unicode_path(path):
  97     # type: (TPath) -> Text
  98     # Paths are supposed to be represented as unicode here
  99     if six.PY2 and isinstance(path, six.binary_type):
 100         return path.decode(_fs_encoding)
 101     return path
 102 
 103 
 104 def native_path(path):
 105     # type: (TPath) -> str
 106     if six.PY2 and isinstance(path, six.text_type):
 107         return path.encode(_fs_encoding)
 108     return str(path)
 109

 111 # once again thank you django...
 112 # https://github.com/django/django/blob/fc6b90b/django/utils/_os.py
 113 if six.PY3 or os.name == "nt":
 114     abspathu = os.path.abspath
 115 else:
 116 
 117     def abspathu(path):
 118         # type: (TPath) -> Text
 119         """Version of os.path.abspath that uses the unicode representation of
 120         the current working directory, thus avoiding a UnicodeDecodeError in
 121         join when the cwd has non-ASCII characters."""
 122         if not os.path.isabs(path):
 123             path = os.path.join(os.getcwdu(), path)
 124         return os.path.normpath(path)
 125 
 126 
 127 def normalize_path(path):
 128     # type: (TPath) -> Text
 129     """Return a case-normalized absolute variable-expanded path.
 130 
 131     :param str path: The non-normalized path
 132     :return: A normalized, expanded, case-normalized path
 133     :rtype: str
 134     """
 135 
 136     path = os.path.abspath(os.path.expandvars(os.path.expanduser(str(path))))
 137     if os.name == "nt" and os.path.exists(path):
 138         from ._winconsole import get_long_path
 139 
 140         path = get_long_path(path)
 141 
 142     return os.path.normpath(os.path.normcase(path))
 143 
 144 
 145 def is_in_path(path, parent):
 146     # type: (TPath, TPath) -> bool
 147     """Determine if the provided full path is in the given parent root.
 148 
 149     :param str path: The full path to check the location of.
 150     :param str parent: The parent path to check for membership in
 151     :return: Whether the full path is a member of the provided parent.
 152     :rtype: bool
 153     """
 154 
 155     return normalize_path(path).startswith(normalize_path(parent))
 156 
 157 
 158 def normalize_drive(path):
 159     # type: (TPath) -> Text
 160     """Normalize drive in path so they stay consistent.
 161 
 162     This currently only affects local drives on Windows, which can be
 163     identified with either upper or lower cased drive names. The case is
 164     always converted to uppercase because it seems to be preferred.
 165     """
 166     from .misc import to_text
 167 
 168     if os.name != "nt" or not (
 169         isinstance(path, six.string_types) or getattr(path, "__fspath__", None)
 170     ):
 171         return path  # type: ignore
 172 
 173     drive, tail = os.path.splitdrive(path)
 174     # Only match (lower cased) local drives (e.g. 'c:'), not UNC mounts.
 175     if drive.islower() and len(drive) == 2 and drive[1] == ":":
 176         return "{}{}".format(drive.upper(), tail)
 177 
 178     return to_text(path, encoding="utf-8")
 179 
 180 
 181 def path_to_url(path):
 182     # type: (TPath) -> Text
 183     """Convert the supplied local path to a file uri.
 184 
 185     :param str path: A string pointing to or representing a local path
 186     :return: A `file://` uri for the same location
 187     :rtype: str
 188 
 189     >>> path_to_url("/home/user/code/myrepo/myfile.zip")
 190     'file:///home/user/code/myrepo/myfile.zip'
 191     """
 192     from .misc import to_bytes
 193 
 194     if not path:
 195         return path  # type: ignore
 196     normalized_path = Path(normalize_drive(os.path.abspath(path))).as_posix()
 197     if os.name == "nt" and normalized_path[1] == ":":
 198         drive, _, path = normalized_path.partition(":")
 199         # XXX: This enables us to handle half-surrogates that were never
 200         # XXX: actually part of a surrogate pair, but were just incidentally
 201         # XXX: passed in as a piece of a filename
 202         quoted_path = quote(fs_encode(path))
 203         return fs_decode("file:///{}:{}".format(drive, quoted_path))
 204     # XXX: This is also here to help deal with incidental dangling surrogates
 205     # XXX: on linux, by making sure they are preserved during encoding so that
 206     # XXX: we can urlencode the backslash correctly
 207     bytes_path = to_bytes(normalized_path, errors="backslashreplace")
 208     return fs_decode("file://{}".format(quote(bytes_path)))
 209 
 210 
 211 def url_to_path(url):
 212     # type: (str) -> str
 213     """Convert a valid file url to a local filesystem path.
 214 
 215     Follows logic taken from pip's equivalent function
 216     """
 217 
 218     assert is_file_url(url), "Only file: urls can be converted to local paths"
 219     _, netloc, path, _, _ = urllib_parse.urlsplit(url)
 220     # Netlocs are UNC paths
 221     if netloc:
 222         netloc = "\\\\" + netloc
 223 
 224     path = urllib_request.url2pathname(netloc + path)
 225     return urllib_parse.unquote(path)
 226 
 227 
 228 def is_valid_url(url):
 229     # type: (Union[str, bytes]) -> bool
 230     """Checks if a given string is an url."""
 231     from .misc import to_text
 232 
 233     if not url:
 234         return url  # type: ignore
 235     pieces = urllib_parse.urlparse(to_text(url))
 236     return all([pieces.scheme, pieces.netloc])
 237 
 238 
 239 def is_file_url(url):
 240     # type: (Any) -> bool
 241     """Returns true if the given url is a file url."""
 242     from .misc import to_text
 243 
 244     if not url:
 245         return False
 246     if not isinstance(url, six.string_types):
 247         try:
 248             url = url.url
 249         except AttributeError:
 250             raise ValueError("Cannot parse url from unknown type: {!r}".format(url))
 251     url = to_text(url, encoding="utf-8")
 252     return urllib_parse.urlparse(url.lower()).scheme == "file"
 253 
 254 
 255 def is_readonly_path(fn):
 256     # type: (TPath) -> bool
 257     """Check if a provided path exists and is readonly.
 258 
 259     Permissions check is `bool(path.stat & stat.S_IREAD)` or `not
 260     os.access(path, os.W_OK)`
 261     """
 262 
 263     fn = fs_decode(fs_encode(fn))
 264     if os.path.exists(fn):
 265         file_stat = os.stat(fn).st_mode
 266         return not bool(file_stat & stat.S_IWRITE) or not os.access(fn, os.W_OK)
 267     return False
 268 
 269 
 270 def mkdir_p(newdir, mode=0o777):
 271     # type: (TPath, int) -> None
 272     """Recursively creates the target directory and all of its parents if they
 273     do not already exist.  Fails silently if they do.
 274 
 275     :param str newdir: The directory path to ensure
 276     :raises: OSError if a file is encountered along the way
 277     """
 278     newdir = fs_decode(fs_encode(newdir))
 279     if os.path.exists(newdir):
 280         if not os.path.isdir(newdir):
 281             raise OSError(
 282                 "a file with the same name as the desired dir, '{}', already exists.".format(
 283                     fs_decode(newdir)
 284                 )
 285             )
 286         return None
 287     os.makedirs(newdir, mode)
 288 
 289 
 290 def ensure_mkdir_p(mode=0o777):
 291     # type: (int) -> Callable[Callable[..., Any], Callable[..., Any]]
 292     """Decorator to ensure `mkdir_p` is called to the function's return
 293     value."""
 294 
 295     def decorator(f):
 296         # type: (Callable[..., Any]) -> Callable[..., Any]
 297         @functools.wraps(f)
 298         def decorated(*args, **kwargs):
 299             # type: () -> str
 300             path = f(*args, **kwargs)
 301             mkdir_p(path, mode=mode)
 302             return path
 303 
 304         return decorated
 305 
 306     return decorator
 307 
 308 
 309 TRACKED_TEMPORARY_DIRECTORIES = []
 310 
 311 
 312 def create_tracked_tempdir(*args, **kwargs):
 313     # type: (Any, Any) -> str
 314     """Create a tracked temporary directory.
 315 
 316     This uses `TemporaryDirectory`, but does not remove the directory when
 317     the return value goes out of scope, instead registers a handler to cleanup
 318     on program exit.
 319 
 320     The return value is the path to the created directory.
 321     """
 322 
 323     tempdir = TemporaryDirectory(*args, **kwargs)
 324     TRACKED_TEMPORARY_DIRECTORIES.append(tempdir)
 325     atexit.register(tempdir.cleanup)
 326     warnings.simplefilter("ignore", ResourceWarning)
 327     return tempdir.name
 328 
 329 
 330 def create_tracked_tempfile(*args, **kwargs):
 331     # type: (Any, Any) -> str
 332     """Create a tracked temporary file.
 333 
 334     This uses the `NamedTemporaryFile` construct, but does not remove the file
 335     until the interpreter exits.
 336 
 337     The return value is the file object.
 338     """
 339 
 340     kwargs["wrapper_class_override"] = _TrackedTempfileWrapper
 341     return _NamedTemporaryFile(*args, **kwargs)
 342 
 343 
 344 def _find_icacls_exe():
 345     # type: () -> Optional[Text]
 346     if os.name == "nt":
 347         paths = [
 348             os.path.expandvars(r"%windir%\{0}").format(subdir)
 349             for subdir in ("system32", "SysWOW64")
 350         ]
 351         for path in paths:
 352             icacls_path = next(
 353                 iter(fn for fn in os.listdir(path) if fn.lower() == "icacls.exe"), None
 354             )
 355             if icacls_path is not None:
 356                 icacls_path = os.path.join(path, icacls_path)
 357                 return icacls_path
 358     return None
 359 
 360 
 361 def set_write_bit(fn):
 362     # type: (str) -> None
 363     """Set read-write permissions for the current user on the target path. Fail
 364     silently if the path doesn't exist.
 365 
 366     :param str fn: The target filename or path
 367     :return: None
 368     """
 369 
 370     fn = fs_decode(fs_encode(fn))
 371     if not os.path.exists(fn):
 372         return
 373     file_stat = os.stat(fn).st_mode
 374     os.chmod(fn, file_stat | stat.S_IRWXU | stat.S_IRWXG | stat.S_IRWXO)
 375     if os.name == "nt":
 376         from ._winconsole import get_current_user
 377 
 378         user_sid = get_current_user()
 379         icacls_exe = _find_icacls_exe() or "icacls"
 380         from .misc import run
 381 
 382         if user_sid:
 383             c = run(
 384                 [
 385                     icacls_exe,
 386                     "''{}''".format(fn),
 387                     "/grant",
 388                     "{}:WD".format(user_sid),
 389                     "/T",
 390                     "/C",
 391                     "/Q",
 392                 ],
 393                 nospin=True,
 394                 return_object=True,
 395             )
 396             if not c.err and c.returncode == 0:
 397                 return
 398 
 399     if not os.path.isdir(fn):
 400         for path in [fn, os.path.dirname(fn)]:
 401             try:
 402                 os.chflags(path, 0)
 403             except AttributeError:
 404                 pass
 405         return None
 406     for root, dirs, files in os.walk(fn, topdown=False):
 407         for dir_ in [os.path.join(root, d) for d in dirs]:
 408             set_write_bit(dir_)
 409         for file_ in [os.path.join(root, f) for f in files]:
 410             set_write_bit(file_)
 411 
 412 
 413 def rmtree(directory, ignore_errors=False, onerror=None):
 414     # type: (str, bool, Optional[Callable]) -> None
 415     """Stand-in for :func:`~shutil.rmtree` with additional error-handling.
 416 
 417     This version of `rmtree` handles read-only paths, especially in the case of index
 418     files written by certain source control systems.
 419 
 420     :param str directory: The target directory to remove
 421     :param bool ignore_errors: Whether to ignore errors, defaults to False
 422     :param func onerror: An error handling function, defaults to :func:`handle_remove_readonly`
 423 
 424     .. note::
 425 
 426        Setting `ignore_errors=True` may cause this to silently fail to delete the path
 427     """
 428 
 429     directory = fs_decode(fs_encode(directory))
 430     if onerror is None:
 431         onerror = handle_remove_readonly
 432     try:
 433         shutil.rmtree(directory, ignore_errors=ignore_errors, onerror=onerror)
 434     except (IOError, OSError, FileNotFoundError, PermissionError) as exc:  # noqa:B014
 435         # Ignore removal failures where the file doesn't exist
 436         if exc.errno != errno.ENOENT:
 437             raise
 438 
 439 
 440 def _wait_for_files(path):  # pragma: no cover
 441     # type: (Union[str, TPath]) -> Optional[List[TPath]]
 442     """Retry with backoff up to 1 second to delete files from a directory.
 443 
 444     :param str path: The path to crawl to delete files from
 445     :return: A list of remaining paths or None
 446     :rtype: Optional[List[str]]
 447     """
 448     timeout = 0.001
 449     remaining = []
 450     while timeout < 1.0:
 451         remaining = []
 452         if os.path.isdir(path):
 453             L = os.listdir(path)
 454             for target in L:
 455                 _remaining = _wait_for_files(target)
 456                 if _remaining:
 457                     remaining.extend(_remaining)
 458             continue
 459         try:
 460             os.unlink(path)
 461         except FileNotFoundError as e:
 462             if e.errno == errno.ENOENT:
 463                 return
 464         except (OSError, IOError, PermissionError):  # noqa:B014
 465             time.sleep(timeout)
 466             timeout *= 2
 467             remaining.append(path)
 468         else:
 469             return
 470     return remaining
 471 
 472 
 473 def handle_remove_readonly(func, path, exc):
 474     # type: (Callable[..., str], TPath, Tuple[Type[OSError], OSError, TracebackType]) -> None
 475     """Error handler for shutil.rmtree.
 476 
 477     Windows source repo folders are read-only by default, so this error handler
 478     attempts to set them as writeable and then proceed with deletion.
 479 
 480     :param function func: The caller function
 481     :param str path: The target path for removal
 482     :param Exception exc: The raised exception
 483 
 484     This function will call check :func:`is_readonly_path` before attempting to call
 485     :func:`set_write_bit` on the target path and try again.
 486     """
 487     # Check for read-only attribute
 488     from .compat import ResourceWarning, FileNotFoundError, PermissionError
 489 
 490     PERM_ERRORS = (errno.EACCES, errno.EPERM, errno.ENOENT)
 491     default_warning_message = "Unable to remove file due to permissions restriction: {!r}"
 492     # split the initial exception out into its type, exception, and traceback
 493     exc_type, exc_exception, exc_tb = exc
 494     if is_readonly_path(path):
 495         # Apply write permission and call original function
 496         set_write_bit(path)
 497         try:
 498             func(path)
 499         except (  # noqa:B014
 500             OSError,
 501             IOError,
 502             FileNotFoundError,
 503             PermissionError,
 504         ) as e:  # pragma: no cover
 505             if e.errno in PERM_ERRORS:
 506                 if e.errno == errno.ENOENT:
 507                     return
 508                 remaining = None
 509                 if os.path.isdir(path):
 510                     remaining = _wait_for_files(path)
 511                 if remaining:
 512                     warnings.warn(default_warning_message.format(path), ResourceWarning)
 513                 else:
 514                     func(path, ignore_errors=True)
 515                 return
 516 
 517     if exc_exception.errno in PERM_ERRORS:
 518         set_write_bit(path)
 519         remaining = _wait_for_files(path)
 520         try:
 521             func(path)
 522         except (OSError, IOError, FileNotFoundError, PermissionError) as e:  # noqa:B014
 523             if e.errno in PERM_ERRORS:
 524                 if e.errno != errno.ENOENT:  # File still exists
 525                     warnings.warn(default_warning_message.format(path), ResourceWarning)
 526             return
 527     else:
 528         raise exc_exception
 529 
 530 
 531 def walk_up(bottom):
 532     # type: (Union[TPath, str]) -> Generator[Tuple[str, List[str], List[str]], None, None]
 533     """Mimic os.walk, but walk 'up' instead of down the directory tree.
 534 
 535     From: https://gist.github.com/zdavkeos/1098474
 536     """
 537     bottom = os.path.realpath(str(bottom))
 538     # Get files in current dir.
 539     try:
 540         names = os.listdir(bottom)
 541     except Exception:
 542         return
 543 
 544     dirs, nondirs = [], []
 545     for name in names:
 546         if os.path.isdir(os.path.join(bottom, name)):
 547             dirs.append(name)
 548         else:
 549             nondirs.append(name)
 550     yield bottom, dirs, nondirs
 551 
 552     new_path = os.path.realpath(os.path.join(bottom, ".."))
 553     # See if we are at the top.
 554     if new_path == bottom:
 555         return
 556 
 557     for x in walk_up(new_path):
 558         yield x
 559 
 560 
 561 def check_for_unc_path(path):
 562     # type: (Path) -> bool
 563     """Checks to see if a pathlib `Path` object is a unc path or not."""
 564     if (
 565         os.name == "nt"
 566         and len(path.drive) > 2
 567         and not path.drive[0].isalpha()
 568         and path.drive[1] != ":"
 569     ):
 570         return True
 571     else:
 572         return False
 573 
 574 
 575 def get_converted_relative_path(path, relative_to=None):
 576     # type: (TPath, Optional[TPath]) -> str
 577     """Convert `path` to be relative.
 578 
 579     Given a vague relative path, return the path relative to the given
 580     location.
 581 
 582     :param str path: The location of a target path
 583     :param str relative_to: The starting path to build against, optional
 584     :returns: A relative posix-style path with a leading `./`
 585 
 586     This performs additional conversion to ensure the result is of POSIX form,
 587     and starts with `./`, or is precisely `.`.
 588 
 589     >>> os.chdir('/home/user/code/myrepo/myfolder')
 590     >>> vistir.path.get_converted_relative_path('/home/user/code/file.zip')
 591     './../../file.zip'
 592     >>> vistir.path.get_converted_relative_path('/home/user/code/myrepo/myfolder/mysubfolder')
 593     './mysubfolder'
 594     >>> vistir.path.get_converted_relative_path('/home/user/code/myrepo/myfolder')
 595     '.'
 596     """
 597     from .misc import to_text, to_bytes  # noqa
 598 
 599     if not relative_to:
 600         relative_to = os.getcwdu() if six.PY2 else os.getcwd()
 601     if six.PY2:
 602         path = to_bytes(path, encoding="utf-8")
 603     else:
 604         path = to_text(path, encoding="utf-8")
 605     relative_to = to_text(relative_to, encoding="utf-8")
 606     start_path = Path(relative_to)
 607     try:
 608         start = start_path.resolve()
 609     except OSError:
 610         start = start_path.absolute()
 611 
 612     # check if there is a drive letter or mount point
 613     # if it is a mountpoint use the original absolute path
 614     # instead of the unc path
 615     if check_for_unc_path(start):
 616         start = start_path.absolute()
 617 
 618     path = start.joinpath(path).relative_to(start)
 619 
 620     # check and see if the path that was passed into the function is a UNC path
 621     # and raise value error if it is not.
 622     if check_for_unc_path(path):
 623         raise ValueError("The path argument does not currently accept UNC paths")
 624 
 625     relpath_s = to_text(posixpath.normpath(path.as_posix()))
 626     if not (relpath_s == "." or relpath_s.startswith("./")):
 627         relpath_s = posixpath.join(".", relpath_s)
 628     return relpath_s
 629 
 630 
 631 def safe_expandvars(value):
 632     # type: (TPath) -> str
 633     """Call os.path.expandvars if value is a string, otherwise do nothing."""
 634     if isinstance(value, six.string_types):
 635         return os.path.expandvars(value)
 636     return value  # type: ignore
 637 
 638 
 639 class _TrackedTempfileWrapper(_TemporaryFileWrapper, object):
 640     def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
 641         super(_TrackedTempfileWrapper, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
 642         self._finalizer = finalize(self, self.cleanup)
 643 
 644     @classmethod
 645     def _cleanup(cls, fileobj):
 646         try:
 647             fileobj.close()
 648         finally:
 649             os.unlink(fileobj.name)
 650 
 651     def cleanup(self):
 652         if self._finalizer.detach():
 653             try:
 654                 self.close()
 655             finally:
 656                 os.unlink(self.name)
 657         else:
 658             try:
 659                 self.close()
 660             except OSError:
 661                 pass
